intro: Cruddasia multifoliolata, commonly known as the many-leaved cruddasia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are often deeply lobed, giving it a distinctive, ornamental appearance. It is valued in horticulture for its compact growth habit and ability to attract pollinators.
